2052.subject: SBS
2052.descrlong: Introduces students to the diverse Mexican peoples and cultures that have emigrated to the U.S. Explores the cultural similarities and differences within such immigrant groups and compares the learning experiences of U.S. and Mexican teachers and their students. Also reviews current standards and materials used in Mexican public schools. Formerly known as SBSC 384S.

2124.subject: SBS
2124.course_title_long: Anthropology of Education: Cultural Contexts of Bilingual Education
2124.descrlong: Introduces the study of schooling in California making emphasis in the perspective of minority groups and explores the concept of transnational cultural experiences. Explores the cultural similarities and differences within such immigrant groups and compares the learning experiences of U.S. and Mexican teachers and their students.

2261.course_title_long: Anthropology of Education: Cultural Contexts of Bilingual Education
2261.descrlong:
Introduces the study of schooling in California making emphasis in the perspective of minority groups and explores the concept of transnational cultural experiences. Explores the cultural similarities and differences within such immigrant groups and compares the learning experiences of U.S. and Mexican teachers and their students.

(Prereq: Junior or Senior Standing)
